title: [K-12] Digital Self-Directed Nursing Learner Competency Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic nursing theory and practical experience
context.additional_context: A program designed to strengthen digital competencies required in the Fourth Industrial Revolution by creating personalized learning pathways in a BYOD environment. It applies Professor Huh Tae-geo’s pedagogy to promote learners’ self-directedness and reflective thinking.

learning_goals: Learners can design and implement nonlinear learning pathways using digital tools
Learners can autonomously complete 80% or more of practical scenarios through self-directed decision-making during the learning process
Learners can improve their learning strategies three or more times through reflective journaling utilizing metacognition
Learners can perform double-loop learning—revising learning goals based on peer feedback—two or more times
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
